content: That's a great point about "imagined orders" and how they shape our habits and behaviors. I'll definitely keep that in mind as I continue listening to the book. Another thing that caught my attention was Harari's discussion of the role of agriculture in human history. It made me think about my own eating habits and how they're influenced by the food industry and cultural norms. Do you have any recommendations for books that explore the psychology and sociology of food and eating?
